sections.heading: Superlative Overview
sections.content:
Japanese superlatives use 一番 (ichiban) meaning "number one" or "the most." Unlike English, adjectives don't change - just add 一番.

一番 + [adjective] "the most [adjective]" 一番高い - the most expensive / the highest 一番大きい - the biggest 一番好き - like the most / favorite

children.heading: Structure
children.content:
[Group] の中で A が一番 [adjective]

[Group] の中で [Subject] が 一番 [Adjective] "Among [group], [subject] is the most [adjective]" クラスの中で田中さんが一番背が高い "Among the class, Tanaka is the tallest"

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content: 一番高い "the most expensive / the highest" 一番大きい "the biggest" 一番美味しい "the most delicious" 一番難しい "the most difficult" 一番楽しい "the most fun"

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content: 一番便利だ / 一番便利です "the most convenient" 一番静かだ / 一番静かです "the quietest" 一番きれいだ / 一番きれいです "the most beautiful / the prettiest" 一番有名だ / 一番有名です "the most famous"

children.heading: 何が一番 (what is the most)
children.content: 何が一番好きですか？ "What do you like the most?" 何が一番美味しいですか？ "What is the most delicious?" 何が一番難しいですか？ "What is the most difficult?"

children.heading: どれが一番 (which is the most)
children.content: A と B と C の中で、どれが一番好きですか？ "Among A, B, and C, which do you like the most?" この中で、どれが一番高いですか？ "Among these, which is the most expensive?"

children.heading: 誰が一番 (who is the most)
children.content: クラスで誰が一番背が高いですか？ "Who is the tallest in the class?" 誰が一番日本語が上手ですか？ "Who is the best at Japanese?"

children.heading: どこが一番 (where is the most)
children.content: 日本でどこが一番好きですか？ "Where in Japan do you like the most?" どこが一番きれいですか？ "Where is the most beautiful?"

children.heading: の中で (among, within)
children.content: クラスの中で一番 "the most in the class" 家族の中で一番 "the most in the family" 日本の中で一番 "the most in Japan" 世界の中で一番 "the most in the world" この中で一番 "the most among these"

children.heading: で (place/scope marker)
children.content: クラスで一番 "the most in the class" 日本で一番 "the most in Japan" 世界で一番 "the most in the world"

children.heading: Favorites
children.content: 一番好き "like the most / favorite" 一番嫌い "dislike the most / least favorite" 一番好きな食べ物 "favorite food" 一番好きな映画 "favorite movie"

children.heading: Size
children.content: 一番大きい "the biggest" 一番小さい "the smallest" 一番高い (tall) "the tallest" 一番低い "the lowest / shortest"

children.heading: Quality
children.content: 一番良い / 一番いい "the best" 一番悪い "the worst" 一番美味しい "the most delicious" 一番面白い "the most interesting"

children.heading: Difficulty
children.content: 一番難しい "the most difficult" 一番易しい / 一番簡単 "the easiest" 一番複雑 "the most complex"

sections.heading: Answering Superlative Questions
sections.content: Q: 何が一番好きですか？ "What do you like the most?" A: 寿司が一番好きです "I like sushi the most" Q: どの季節が一番好きですか？ "Which season do you like the most?" A: 春が一番好きです "I like spring the most" Q: 誰が一番速いですか？ "Who is the fastest?" A: 田中さんが一番速いです "Tanaka is the fastest"

children.heading: Example 1: Favorites
children.content: A: 何の食べ物が一番好きですか？ "What food do you like the most?" B: ラーメンが一番好きです "I like ramen the most" A: どこのラーメンが一番美味しいですか？ "Where has the most delicious ramen?" B: 博多のラーメンが一番美味しいと思います "I think Hakata ramen is the most delicious"

children.heading: Example 2: Comparisons
children.content: A: この3つの中で、どれが一番安いですか？ "Among these three, which is the cheapest?" B: これが一番安いです "This one is the cheapest" A: 一番高いのは？ "Which is the most expensive?" B: あれが一番高いです "That one is the most expensive"

children.heading: Example 3: Personal Questions
children.content: A: 日本で一番好きな場所はどこですか？ "What's your favorite place in Japan?" B: 京都が一番好きです "I like Kyoto the most" A: どうしてですか？ "Why?" B: 一番きれいだし、一番静かだから "Because it's the most beautiful and the most quiet"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Forgetting が Particle
children.content: Wrong: 寿司一番好きです ❌ Right: 寿司が一番好きです ✓ "I like sushi the most"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using より with 一番
children.content: Wrong: 一番より高い ❌ Right: 一番高い ✓ "the most expensive"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Adding -est to Adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 一番高いest ❌ Right: 一番高い ✓ "the highest"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Wrong Word Order
children.content: Wrong: 高い一番 ❌ Right: 一番高い ✓ "the most expensive"

children.heading: 一番上 (ichiban ue) - the top
children.content: 一番上の本 "the top book" クラスで一番上 "the top of the class"

children.heading: 一番下 (ichiban shita) - the bottom
children.content: 一番下の引き出し "the bottom drawer"

children.heading: 一番前 (ichiban mae) - the very front
children.content: 一番前の席 "the front-most seat"

children.heading: 一番後ろ (ichiban ushiro) - the very back
children.content: 一番後ろの列 "the back-most row"

sections.heading: With Time Expressions
sections.content: 一年で一番暑い月 "the hottest month of the year" 今まで一番楽しかった "the most fun I've ever had" 人生で一番大切なもの "the most important thing in life" 今まで一番美味しい料理 "the most delicious food I've ever had"

sections.heading: Multiple Superlatives
sections.content: 一番大きくて一番高い "the biggest and the most expensive" 一番きれいで一番親切 "the most beautiful and the kindest" 世界で一番高くて一番有名な山 "the world's tallest and most famous mountain"

children.heading: Countries/Cities
children.content: 日本で一番大きい都市 "the biggest city in Japan" 世界で一番高い山 "the world's highest mountain" アジアで一番人口が多い国 "the most populated country in Asia"

children.heading: Examples
children.content: 東京は日本で一番大きい都市です "Tokyo is the biggest city in Japan" 富士山は日本で一番高い山です "Mt. Fuji is the highest mountain in Japan" この店はこの町で一番有名です "This store is the most famous in this town"

children.heading: 一番～ない (least)
children.content: 一番好きじゃない "like the least" 一番高くない "the least expensive" 一番面白くない "the least interesting"

children.heading: Examples
children.content: これが一番好きじゃない "I like this the least" 冬が一番好きじゃないです "I like winter the least"
